application.splashScreen

Class SplashScreen_Preloader

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • javafx.application.Preloader
        • application.splashScreen.SplashScreen_Preloader

  • public class SplashScreen_Preloader
extends javafx.application.Preloader
    Copyright 2015, FHNW, Prof. Dr. Brad Richards. All rights reserved. This code is licensed under the terms of the BSD 3-clause license (see the file license.txt). A Preloader is an independent GUI within an application that can be displayed quickly. If a program is being started across the network, the classes for the preloader can be packaged separately, so that they download first. When the main program is ready, the Preloader is hidden, and the main program takes its place on the stage. In principle, a Preloader would be a great way to display a splash screen for any program. Unfortunately, there is no simple way to start and debug a an application and preloader in an IDE, and have them work exactly the same way that they will when deployed. For this reason, the Application Template *does* *not* use this Preloader. It is shown here only for completeness. For further information, refer to the Java Tutorials: https://docs.oracle.com/javafx/2/deployment/preloaders.htm A Preloader can receive various kinds of updates from the main application. This example includes all four, but only use the ones you need.
    Author:
    Brad Richards
